channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report X-2023071201
item.description:
Report X-2023071201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT WAS HELD DUE TO SUSPISION OF LEAKAGE. I FOUND THAT IT WAS IN FACT LEAKING ONCE I OPENED THE INNER BOX. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FAILURE WAS IN THE CLOSURE/LID. ONE OF THE GALLONS OF BAQUACIL HAD A LOOSE LID WHICH CAUSED IT TO LEAK ON THE BAG IT WAS IN. THAT SOLUTION EVENTUALLY LEAKED OUT ONTO THE INNER AND OUTER BOX DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE GALLONS WERE TAKEN OUT OF THE TWO BOXES AND PUT INTO A LINED DRUM AFTER TIGHTENING THE LIDS.

item.title: Report E-2023070606
item.description:
Report E-2023070606

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: FLORENCE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/16/2023, at 1720 hours, personnel in the CSX Florence Yard (Florence, SC) discovered DAKX 29917, a loaded tank car of Ethylene Glycol, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Sabic, was notified (CHEMTREC Report 2023-0716-00035). HEPACO, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found liquid product to be leaking between the liquid line valve mounting flange and the car’s pressure plate. Contractor personnel vented the car’s pressure to stop the release. The issue identified and containment measures were communicated to Sabic’s representative- Greg Horton (Greg.Horton2@Sabic.com, 812-305-2295). The car was held at the CSX Florence Yard pending additional repair and qualification or OTMA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damage hazmat was reported to QA by vanline manager after being dropped and placed improperly by package handler. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 plastic bottles that contained hazardous liquid had a small hole near handle on the jug causing liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damage hazmat was placed into hazmat bag and bucket
